TITULO: ESPECIALISTA DE PROJETOS ESPECIAIS | ANÁLISE DE DADOS E ESTATÍSTICAS

DESCRICAO:
Today HP is a $50+ billion fortune 50 company with just under 50,000 employees worldwide across 190 countries. HP is about innovation, it’s who we are and what we have been doing since 1939, we keep reinventing ourselves. Together we challenge convention, pushing each other to surprise the world.

The HP in-house media team is responsible for planning, buying and maintain programmatic and biddable ad campaigns in multiple DSPs, Social, and Search platforms. The LATAM Media Planning role is responsible for delivering best practices in media strategy, planning, and buying across all communications channels, the team’s overall effectiveness, with the individual leveraging their expertise in managing the operations for digital media reporting and analysis to ensure HP’s advertising objectives are met while maintaining a balance of performance and efficiency.

Responsibilities Include
Main point of contact with campaign managers, internal and external agency partners, and media representatives for one of the business units across LATAM with focus on Brazil
Translate media briefs into strategic plans to meet goals/objectives by leading holistic media planning for a portfolio of brands across all media channels such as Paid Social, Programmatic, Search, CTV (Connected TV), TV, Print, Audio, etc.
Creating actionable audience and performance insights in collaboration with campaign managers, agencies, and media activations specialists
Identifying and implementing creative and data-informed media ideas and tactics to drive continuously improving campaign performance.
Leverage industry planning tools, data, market understanding and a relentless focus on the consumer to conduct audience identification analysis and scenario planning.
Partner with in-house media activation teams to plan, execute and optimize media investment across channels/marketplaces.
Partner with Media Data science, Analytics, Reporting and Insights to evaluate emerging media opportunities and execute on-going Test & Learns to fuel insights and innovation.
Requirements
Strong background across offline and online media channels. Digital channels including Programmatic, Social and Search
Experience using industry standard planning tools & data sets to create insight driven media plans and optimizations.
Strong analytics background: Able to triangulate between data, media goals and opportunities to make recommendations and optimize plans.
Leadership qualities, entrepreneurial mindset, results driven.
Working knowledge and experience with media principles, marketing activities, tactics, and tools.
Experienced and confident in presenting complex data in an easy format to top management.
5+ years of experience in media planning and buying on agency or brand side.
Experience managing/developing a team.
Bachelor’s degree
Professional working proficiency in English, Portuguese, and Spanish
Solid knowledge of the Brazilian market media space
What We Offer
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP’s own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefit package.
Work life balance /flexible working hours and flexible WFH policy
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular activities.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and Disability networks! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally.
Reinventing since 1939. We are one of the leading Print and Personal Systems technology companies in the world and our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere - every person, every organization, and every community around the globe. To invent, and to reinvent.

About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

O que esperamos de você:


Ensino Superior completo em em Matemática e/ou Estatística com ênfase a Computação.
Pós, Mestrado ou Doutorado, será um diferencial.
Experiência prévia na função em empresa de médio e grande porte com infra estruturas de dados mais "parrudas".
Experiência prévia no segmento de varejo físico/digital será um diferencial.
Domínio de Linguagens de Programação Python e SQL.
Domínio em testes de hipótese, probabilidade, estatística, álgebra linear e cálculo.
Conhecimentos de workflow e agendamentos de tarefas (Airflow).
Experiência em desenvolvimento em nuvem (Google Cloud Platform - GCP).
Experiência em desenvolver modelos no ecossistema Big Data/ Hadoop (Hive, MapReduce, Storm, Flume, etc).
Conhecimentos de modelagem e estruturação de dados.

Como é o dia a dia:

Criar modelos de alta eficiência para resultados preditivos (regressão, classificação, clustering e séries temporais) e prescritivos (otimização matemática e pesquisa operacional) afim de gerar insights de negócio relevantes.
Realizar tratamento de bases de dados (dados faltantes e inconsistentes), assim como processá-los, e habilidades de identificação de atributos não triviais/transformação de atributos já existentes em novos (feature engineering).
Coordenar atividades em conjunto com as áreas de negócio identificando gargalos e oportunidades de ganhos em capacidade ou financeiro utilizando ferramentas de simulação, estatística e análise avançadas.
Conceber não apenas as soluções, mas também suas arquiteturas, orientadas a dados para os desafios de entendimento dos clientes em ambientes de Big Data.
Criar visualizações de dados adaptadas para cada caso assegurando um formato de comunicação eficiente das previsões e resultados para a gestão e os departamentos solicitantes.
Apoiar a camada gestora na tomada de decisões através da análise de dados e correlações não intuitivas.
Realizar treinamentos frequentes e abertos aos gestores de forma a qualificar em relação as mais atuais técnicas analíticas, tais como machine learning, deep learning e text analytics nas áreas em que sejam relevantes.
Compartilhar o conhecimento de ciência de dados dentro da equipe de BI Analytics e Chapter de IA.

Obrigado pelo seu interesse em fazer parte da nossa construção!


Desejamos boa sorte no seu processo!

Não deixe de visitar uma loja e conhecer ainda mais sobre como é fazer parte do nosso time, vendo de perto as pessoas que entregam as melhores experiências para nossos clientes.

Incentivamos a diversidade e a inclusão, por isso, todas as vagas estão disponíveis para Pessoas com Deficiências (PcD).


#ConstruímosCarreiras

TITULO: Chief Product and Technology Officer, gt.school (Remote) - $800,000/year USD
DESCRICAO:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?

Are you ready to spearhead a groundbreaking educational revolution? gt.school is seeking a visionary technical product manager to lead the development and implementation of a revolutionary educational platform that combines the captivating appeal of TikTok with the educational power of Neal Stevenson's "A Young Lady's Illustrated Primer." If you are passionate about transforming the way students learn and possess the technical prowess and product management expertise to turn this vision into reality, then we have an opportunity that will ignite your enthusiasm and drive your career to new heights.

At gt.school, we are on a mission to accelerate the pace of learning by 5-10X, leveraging the incredible potential of technology, algorithms, and generative AI. Inspired by the transformative qualities of "A Young Lady's Illustrated Primer," we aim to create a platform where students can discover, explore, and learn at an unprecedented rate. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life.

Imagine building a TikTok for Education, where students no longer follow influencers but embark on an immersive learning journey, following subjects that pique their curiosity. Instead of aimlessly scrolling through random videos, they will be served targeted, interactive content such as videos, flashcards, and other engaging materials inspired by the learning algorithm in TikTok.

Passion for education and innovation is a must. We are a team of individuals driven by a deep understanding of education, coupled with a rich technical culture and domain expertise. With a school of 200 students already under our belt, we have an intimate knowledge of the challenges and opportunities in the education landscape. Now, with the advent of generative AI, we are poised to take education to new heights, and we are seeking a product owner who shares our enthusiasm and technical skills.

Join us in this exhilarating journey to transform education on a global scale. You will be at the forefront of the Golden Age of disruption in education. If you are ready to apply your technical expertise, product management mindset, and unwavering passion to creating a future where learning knows no bounds, then come and join our team. Together, we will build products that accelerate learning, redefine education, and empower the next generation of learners.

What You Will Be Doing

Conceptualizing and developing the product: collaborating with cross-functional teams to build a platform that revolutionizes education by enabling students to follow subjects and receive targeted learning content.
Making strategic decisions: utilizing market research and data analysis to inform strategic decisions related to product development, feature prioritization, and technology adoption.
Leveraging your entrepreneurial mindset to identify opportunities, evaluate risks, and make informed decisions that align with the company's vision.
Developing an MVP by translating abstract guidance into detailed specifications; actively engaging in discussions and capturing requirements from stakeholders.
Using your product management experience to define sprints, stories, and development milestones for the engineering team.
Embracing an iterative approach, continuously seeking customer feedback, and using data to drive product enhancements.
Providing technical leadership and product delivery: leading the product development team, ensuring high-quality deliverables and adherence to project timelines. Collaborating with engineering leadership to solve problems through automation, advanced algorithms, and optimized data structures.
Sharing the company's passion for education and embracing the disruptive potential of generative AI in the learning process. Staying up to date with the latest advancements in education technology and fostering a culture of innovation within the organization.

Basic Requirements

Chief Product and Technology Officer key responsibilities

At least 10 years in product management, preferably in a startup or entrepreneurial environment, with a proven track record of success.
Experience owning a product: from defining the requirements to launching the MVP and iterating based on customer feedback, you've been the driving force behind a product.
Strong technical background with the ability to understand and discuss data structures, algorithms, and relevant technologies. Experience with generative AI and machine learning is highly desirable. Must be able to make informed decisions regarding the selection and implementation of appropriate technologies, such as AWS Bedrock or ChatGPT, to support the platform's objectives
Demonstrated leadership capabilities with a focus on driving results, fostering collaboration, and inspiring teams to achieve ambitious goals.
Ability to grasp market dynamics, identify customer needs, and align product strategies accordingly.
A genuine passion for transforming education and leveraging technology to accelerate learning outcomes.

About Gt.school

gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $400 USD/hour, which equates to $800,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-5018-BR-PortoAle-ChiefProductan.003

MonetizeMore is a global leader in ad revenue optimization. Our publisher partners run websites from all over the world and require top-tier solutions. We’ve been running for 13 years, and achieved prestigious Google ad tech and fastest-growing company awards, with over 270+ members around the globe.

MonetizeMore offers location and schedule freedom to every one of its team members. That means that you would have the lifestyle autonomy to choose to work from anywhere in the world, during the time of day you prefer. This new-age work lifestyle would enable you to engineer your ideal lifestyle. Say goodbye to endless commutes, stuffy business attire, and the arbitrary 9 – 5 workday. Take your life back into your hands by joining the MonetizeMore team!

This is your opportunity to learn industry-leading ad optimization practices. Be heavily involved in the core of MonetizeMore by making important ad optimization decisions based on data science techniques, collaborating with a dynamic team to improve ad optimization practices, and working closely with premium publishers to increase their ad revenues. Join a company culture that rewards innovative thinking, results-driven behavior, and strong relationship management. Take your skillset to the next level through our training and by working with some of the best minds in the ad technology industry to make a real difference with MonetizeMore.

Job Summary

MonetizeMore is looking for an Ad Optimizer based in LATAM who can fluently speak English, and Portuguese (Spanish is a plus!) to manage the ad revenue monetization of publisher sites of all sizes.

Responsibilities And Duties

Reviews and assess current ad setup and spot opportunities for revenue lift
Welcomes new publishers via onboarding calls to understand business goals and draft timelines for success
Sets up the entire ad stack in Google Ad Manager based on priorities where publishers can benefit the most
Headerbid configuration, testing, and after live debugs for errors and anomalies happening during the ad calls
Daily ad quality checks to monitor unfilled & ad render behaviors
Analyses publisher performance daily for dips and upticks in key metrics e.g. CPM, Page RPM, Session RPM, ads per page, and all other indicators to address them immediately.
Audits all demand stack partners - Google AdSense, Ad Exchange, Header Bid Partners, and 3rd party demand sources to ensure all impressions are accounted for.
Test out new tech developed and provide feedback on impact to performance
Researches different strategies that can be used to further improve publisher performance.
Proactively presents ideas to the publisher and collaborates with them on how these ideas can further help them achieve their goals.
Tests different approaches in ad optimization and be up to date with the latest tech developments and advertising news that may affect the publisher and MonetizeMore.
Send End-of-Month Performance Insights report to share the efforts made from last month translated to results and provide updates of what’s the next plan of action
Schedule regular monthly or quarterly updates to go over performance and share new tech recently developed
Runs monthly, and annual comparative reports and checks historical data to provide trend analysis for publishers.
Achieve internal KPI benchmarks and external revenue targets for both MonetizeMore and the publishers.

Qualifications And Skills

Exemplifies MonetizeMore's three core pillars; Reliability, Kaizen & Enterpising,
Highly analytical and has an understanding of statistical theories and principles
Proficient in MS Excel & Google Sheets, and data presentation
Superb attention to detail and is cutthroat with numbers, monitoring, and crushing targets
A critical thinker and tech-savvy
Able to communicate effectively and confidently in both written and verbal mediums
Has experience with client relations or customer service
Have a good grasp of the different Google ad platforms and how they work
Understands how website ad monetization works
Thrives in a dynamic workplace and adapts to the constant change in the ad tech industry
A self-starter and a sponge for new learnings
Can adjust and is flexible to varying work schedules
Can work under pressure while maintaining a sense of positivity
Speak fluent English and Portuguese.

Great to Have

Has worked with AdSense, Google Analytics, and GAM and has extensive knowledge of Google policies and other platforms
Built or at least managed a website for ad revenue monetization
Understands coding and has a strong tech background
Has worked with WordPress and is knowledgeable when it comes to implementing ads and debugging ad calls
At least 1-year experience in Programmatic sell-side or any related work

Benefits And Perks

Location freedom (100% remote-working set up)
You get to create your own schedule
Competitive Compensation Package

If you think you are a good fit to join the MonetizeMore ad optimization team, please fill out the application and give specific reasons for what sets you apart. We hire individuals, not robots so don’t be afraid to show a little personality ;)

TITULO: ANALISTA OPERAÇÕES RODOVIÁRIAS SR - FOCO EM BI
DESCRICAO:
O Grupo EcoRodovias é uma das maiores empresas de infraestrutura do país, somos mais de 4.000 colaboradores guiados por valores que nos fazem crescer a cada dia.

E para sermos o melhor gestor de infraestrutura rodoviária do Brasil, precisamos dos melhores e mais competentes profissionais, independente da raça, gênero, orientação sexual, idade, religião, etc.

Se você gosta de trabalhar e construir em equipe, age como dono, busca resultados positivos e tem capacidade de engajar pessoas #VemSerEco.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Estruturar, implantar e administrar indicadores para a área de Operações, contemplando o levantamento de dados a requisitos de análise, até a elaboração de dashboards para apresentação resultados;
Apoiar o processo de estruturação de dados brutos (ETL), transformando os em informações e análises para embasar as decisões estratégicas da empresa;
Desenvolver, estruturar, atualizar e validar os principais relatórios da área;
Realizar a entrega de dados seguros e confiáveis que serão utilizados nos indicadores de BI (Business Intelligence);
Acompanhar mensalmente o planejamento de tráfego da empresa, analisando os dados e realizando o comparativo: previsto x realizado;
Elaborar relatórios e apresentações, através de interface com as áreas, para o acompanhamento e análise de metas, indicadores e projetos estratégicos;
Criar e analisar a projeção de tráfego e receita, para elaboração das tendências do resultado operacional mensal e anual;
Apoiar nas análises do comportamento de tráfego de veículos do sistema rodoviário, elaborando consultas aos dados gerados pelos diversos sensores instalados nas rodovias.

Requisitos e qualificações

Superior completo em Administração, Engenharias, Ciências da Computação e correlatas
Especialização em Business Intelligence, Big Data, Analytics, Data Science ou áreas correlatas será um diferencial
Processos de ETL, SQL Server, Data Warehouse nível intermediário/avançado
Excel e Power B.I nível avançado
VBA e Banco de Dados MySQl nível intermediário
Desejáveis conhecimentos em Scrum e metodologia ágil

Informações adicionais

Vale transporte, Vale refeição e/ou Vale alimentação, Assistência Médica e Seguro de Vida

Assistência odontológica

Fretado/ Estacionamento gratuito (de acordo com a região)

Programa de Participação nos Resultados (PPR)

Previdência privada com contrapartida da empresa

Parceria com Gympass

Cesta de natal

Programas de qualidade de vida sem custo

Acesso a credencial SESI/SESC

Parcerias institucionais

DESCRIÇÃO

Sobre a Área

O departamento de Auditoria Interna do Grupo Carrefour Brasil, reporta para o Comitê de Auditoria Estatutário da Companhia. Ele conduz auditorias financeiras e operacionais nos segmentos de Varejo e Atacadão, incluindo TI e Imobiliário. O objetivo é trazer uma avaliação independente do ambiente de controles internos, de acordo com a metodologia definida junto com o time de auditoria interna na França

Desafios Dessa Posição
Conduzir diversas missões de auditoria (estratégica, operacional, financeira, qualidade, supply chain) através da:
Realização do programa de trabalho: analise preliminar de riscos, walkthrough e testes planejados, documentação a solicitar;
Condução de entrevistas de entendimento dos processos e controles chaves afim de identificar potenciais faltas ou falhas no processos auditados;
Execução de testes de evidencia e efetividade (amostragem) para verificar da boa execução dos controles mapeados;
Desenho, construção e formalização do relatório de auditoria, contendo: visuais demonstrados as analises e os testes realizados, redação dos pontos de atenção, principais conclusões, riscos atrelados, causas raízes e sugestão de planos de remediação;
Apresentação das principais conclusão a diretoria e management da companhia nas reuniões formais de ínterim e fechamento da missão.
Acompanhar a implementação dos planos de ação definidos a raiz das missões de auditoria.
Implantação de técnicas avançadas e inovadoras de auditoria baseada em dados entre elas: modelagem de dados (estruturados e não estruturados) para projetos de Big Data, modelos estatísticos para auditoria preditiva utilizando conceitos de machine learning e criação de Data Visualization com ferramentas de BI.
Identificação de oportunidades de criação de novos indicadores, assim como a definição do modelo e técnica mais apropriadas, estratégia de desenvolvimento e implantação.
Pontualmente, liderar missões de auditoria.
Você Precisa TerREQUISITOS
Graduação em administração de empresas, contabilidade, economia ou engenharia
Experiência nas áreas de Auditoria Interna / Externa, Controles Internos, Financeira ou Consultoria
Excel Avançado
Inglês avançado e/ou Fluente
Conhecimento em Ciências de Dados/Data Analytics será um diferencial.
Local de trabalho: São Paulo, SP
Regime de contratação de tipo: Efetivo – CLT
Jornada: Período Integral
Área e especialização profissional: Auditoria - Auditoria Interna
Nível hierárquico: Consultor
Escolaridade Mínima: Ensino Superior

VALORIZADO

Tempo de experiência: Entre 5 e 10 anos

BENEFÍCIOS
Assistência Médica e Odontológica
PLR (Bônus Anual)
Licença Maternidade / Paternidade?- Estendida
Desconto em compras usando Cartão Carrefour
Cartão Sam’s Club
Dress code? Seja você mesmo, respeitamos a sua individualidade
Benefício Ótica
PAC- Programa de Apoio ao Colaborador:
Avatar da Saúde
Refeitório no Local

Corra is the global digital agency that B2B and B2C brands trust to accelerate their growth. Working at the intersection of commerce technology and customer experience strategy, we are known for our unmatched ability to deliver comprehensive digital solutions to leading B2C and B2B retailers. In recent years, Corra has taken a leadership position with all things Headless and PWA within the commerce space and has launched more PWA/Headless builds than any other agency within our space.

Over the past 15+ years, we have helped merchants enable and scale their commerce vision, channeling our expertise and passion in the Magento Commerce, Adobe Experience Cloud, Shopify Plus, commercetools, fabric and Contentful platforms along with many vetted technology partners.

Winner of multiple Best Places to Work awards, we offer exciting and challenging projects with industry leading companies, competitive health benefits, flexible work arrangements, ongoing career development, company outings and tons of other bonuses.

Corra is looking for a Sr. Analytics Strategist to join our Technology organization. The primary goal of this position is to drive client ecommerce success through the application of Analytics and Data Science to generate actionable insights to our clients. The successful candidate must demonstrate a track record of delivering data insights that increase ROI, client profitability and other metrics of success in addition to being a proven subject matter expert in the technical aspects of the department’s work.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with clients and cross functional teams to help solve problems and deliver actionable insights about our client’s businesses leveraging your analytical skills and advanced reports
Understand user-behavior tracking needs in the ecommerce funnel and build a framework to deploy Analytics tracking within a timeline and budget
Lead the migration strategy of any redesign / re-platform project to maintain and improve event and pixel tracking
Coordinate deliverables and deadlines for multiple clients in a timely manner
Create and manage requirements documentation in the Product Backlog in JIRA and ensure they are prioritized based on business value, risk, and other relevant considerations
Partner with Developers to ensure events are successfully implemented
Attend team and client meetings
Educate and explain the benefits of our Analytics services in internal and client settings
Professionalism to be client facing

Requirements

5 years of delivery experience providing Analytics or other data-driven services across a large and disparate portfolio of ecommerce businesses
Deep experience with data analysis tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), reporting dashboards and visualization techniques common to ecommerce business and technical users
Expert user of Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics (UA and GA4)
Self-starter, organized and detail oriented to own the day-to-day interactions with clients and the internal delivery team for multiple projects/clients
Demonstrated success of collecting and synthesizing complex data to convey business insights and growth opportunities to clients
Ability to communicate conclusions in a story-telling manner to business executives and non-technical audiences
Day-to-day experience working with cross functional teams including product owners, BAs, engineers, designers and more
Demonstrable requirements elicitation, documentation and prioritization skills
Solid time management skills including the ability to work across several projects simultaneously
Passion and curiosity to quickly learn new concepts and enable others
Client-first mentality
Proficient with project management and communication tools (JIRA, Slack, etc.)
Basic or tangential experience in the fields of data science, machine learning, AI, digital marketing analytics or CLM/CRM analytics is a plus
Experience with Adobe Analytics is a plus
Working knowledge of HTML and CSS is a plus

Corra provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, parental status, national origin, disability status, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status or military service, citizenship or immigration status, political affiliation, or other non-merit-based factors and other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

The compensation level for this role is $400 USD/hour, which equates to $800,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. The Position

Our Vision

Our vision is to make CX as transformative as our science and be known for consistently creating seamless customer experiences that are as innovative and impactful as our medicines. This is why we are evolving the LATAM Omnichannel team - to make this a reality by integrating digital and face-to-face interactions seamlessly and allowing us to rapidly identify priorities to engage our customers and establish leadership in the prioritized therapeutic areas.

The Position

As the Analytics and Insights Partner you play a key role in LATAM’s omnichannel customer engagement transformation to drive customer centricity and create seamless customer experiences.

You are responsible to actively collect, analyze and generate insights in a consistent and homogeneous way to support the Network and local teams in their activities to gather customer feedback, segment customers based on their preferences and measure campaign and channel performance, with the overall aim to create personalized customer experiences. You will be working closely with the Global Ecosystem Insights and Advance Analytics teams and Global data management and analytics programs (e.g. EpiCX, RDI) to drive a data-driven culture and insights driven next best actions as it relates to personalized customer engagements.

As part of the LATAM Network Team you will be reporting to the Data Governance & Analytics Lead and directly work with the Network and Affiliate teams to provide on-demand support in their various data analytics and insights generation activities. This can include the creation, maintenance and optimization of dashboards to measure performance of campaigns, channels and content across customer segments, establishing digital customer feedback loops in accordance with the continuous learning and closed-loop feedback strategy and finally creating valuable customer insights. You will be supporting the Business and Customer Success Lead in conducting business reviews by analyzing the KPIs related to the defined outcomes. Based on this, you will also make recommendations for improvements to ensure customer and business success.

You will also be working with the Omnichannel Outcomes Leads to create the measurement plans for the TA omnichannel strategies.


Key Responsibilities

You are responsible for the effective translation of data into valuable insights across all digital (e.g. HCP Portal, emailing, remote engagement, social media) and non-digital touchpoints within the omnichannel TA strategies and their effective communication to various stakeholder groups
Define criteria to prioritize analytics and insights generation demand across LATAM and Affiliates with Network and local stakeholders
Support the Business and Customer Excellence Lead in conducting Regional and Affiliate business reviews by sharing key performance indicators aligned to the defined outcomes, and recommend areas for improvement and action plans where appropriate
Collaborate with Channel Specialists to determine the value and effectiveness of all types of channels, translating incoming data into business results and generated impact
Collaborate with Content Partners to monitor and measure campaign and content performance to showcase their effectiveness and results of marketing campaigns
Partner with the Customer Insights Lead to operationalize customer segmentation into the data collection process and generate meaningful insights for each segment
Ensure alignment and standardization of the data and insights quality according to the Data Governance and Analytics Strategy and coordinate with Data Stewards in the Affiliates to define any actions needed to improve data quality standards
Lead / participate in regional digital analytics projects (e.g. HCP Portal analysis) and liaise with Data Governance & Analytics Lead to raise any business or technical needs (e.g. new data sources)
Within LATAM Network and Affiliate teams and with Global Programs, act as the translator between data experts and the business, facilitating cross functional collaboration
Leverage the Network to capture learnings and create synergies between Affiliates in data gathering and insights generation processes, and share them with Data Governance & Analytics Lead in order to iterate in the Data Governance and Analytics Strategy
Manage and comply with any regulatory requirements related to the above activities
Actively eliminate low value activities, and continuously reevaluate the prioritization and focus of the teams to drive the business forward on highest priorities, while creating synergies and eliminating duplication
Ensure that research is conducted with the highest degree of integrity, in compliance with appropriate policies and SOPs, and that learnings are shared broadly and archived effectively for future reference

What's in it for you?

This is a key role to enable Roche’s new omnichannel customer engagement vision which will provide you will opportunities to work with Senior LATAM stakeholders
You will have the opportunity to work in a Network role and support Affiliates in gaining valuable insights of their customers through the application of data analytics and visualizations helping them to optimize their omnichannel engagement strategies

Role Interfaces

As the Analytics & Insights Partner, you will interact with the following:

Digital Customer Engagement & Insights - LATAM

○ Business and Customer Excellence Lead

○ Customer Insights Lead

○ Data Governance & Analytics Lead

○ CX Specialist

○ Channel Specialist

○ Content Partner

Global

○ Global Ecosystem Insights

○ Global Programs (e.g. EpiCX, RDI, Aspire)

Other LATAM roles & functions

○ Patient Journey Partners (PJPs) & HSPs (Health System Partners)


Experience & Qualifications

Education

Bachelor's degree (scientific, digital, economic or business degree). An advanced degree in Life sciences and/ or MBA is a plus


Professional Experience

5+ years experience in Analytics Translation (i.e translate analytics into insights), Performance Analytics and proven skills working with Data & Analytics platforms, Tableau and Digital Landscape, Channel & Touchpoint Analytics (web, search, social, email, chat, virtual meetings / conferences etc.) and Campaign Analytics
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to translate complex data sets into valuable insights for various stakeholder groups through dashboards and visualization tools
Experience with digital, omnichannel, and associated data/analytics capabilities in large biopharma environments is highly desirable
Experience in understanding customer experiences in a healthcare system set-up and acting on them, improving HCP and patient satisfaction is highly desirable
Ability to understand and translate marketing analytics reports, experience in VVPM (Veeva Vault PromoMats) Content Sharing (DAM) and Approval (MLR) process
Experience in Jupyter notebook, Amazon Athena and Google Analytics is a plus
Excellent project and stakeholder management, interpersonal and organizational skills, as well as the ability to handle multiple projects, demand, priorities and stakeholders simultaneously

Languages

Fluent in English and Spanish (oral & written) is essential


Skills & Competencies

Competencies

Visionary: You have the vision to enhance customer engagement through a data-driven culture, using creative strategic approaches to generate valuable customer insights and enable the team to act on them
Architect: You contribute to a team culture where you motivate others to leverage data and take bold decisions to accelerate a personalized and omnichannel customer engagement
Catalyst: You have an entrepreneurial spirit, providing solutions and removing roadblocks to act quickly upon evolving omnichannel business and customer needs
Coach: You motivate and help Affiliate teams to build the skills and mindsets needed to build a data-driven culture

In addition, the following skills will make you successful in your position and career development at Roche:

Digital Literacy
Risk Taking & Experimentation
Outcomes Based Planning
Systems Thinking
Customer Centricity
Insights Generation
Performance Analytics
Data Science
Analytics Automation
Data Management

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

MonetizeMore is a global leader in ad revenue optimization. Our publisher partners run websites from all over the world and require top-tier solutions. We’ve been running for 13 years, and achieved prestigious Google ad tech and fastest-growing company awards, with over 270+ members around the globe.

MonetizeMore offers location and schedule freedom to every one of its team members. That means that you would have the lifestyle autonomy to choose to work from anywhere in the world, during the time of day you prefer. This new-age work lifestyle would enable you to engineer your ideal lifestyle. Say goodbye to endless commutes, stuffy business attire, and the arbitrary 9 – 5 workday. Take your life back into your hands by joining the MonetizeMore team!

This is your opportunity to learn industry-leading ad optimization practices. Be heavily involved in the core of MonetizeMore by making important ad optimization decisions based on data science techniques, collaborating with a dynamic team to improve ad optimization practices, and working closely with premium publishers to increase their ad revenues. Join a company culture that rewards innovative thinking, results-driven behavior, and strong relationship management. Take your skillset to the next level through our training and by working with some of the best minds in the ad technology industry to make a real difference with MonetizeMore.

Job Summary

MonetizeMore is looking for an Ad Optimizer based in LATAM who can fluently speak English, and Portuguese (Spanish is a plus!) to manage the ad revenue monetization of publisher sites of all sizes.

Responsibilities and Duties

Reviews and assess current ad setup and spot opportunities for revenue lift
Welcomes new publishers via onboarding calls to understand business goals and draft timelines for success
Sets up the entire ad stack in Google Ad Manager based on priorities where publishers can benefit the most
Headerbid configuration, testing, and after live debugs for errors and anomalies happening during the ad calls
Daily ad quality checks to monitor unfilled & ad render behaviors
Analyses publisher performance daily for dips and upticks in key metrics e.g. CPM, Page RPM, Session RPM, ads per page, and all other indicators to address them immediately.
Audits all demand stack partners - Google AdSense, Ad Exchange, Header Bid Partners, and 3rd party demand sources to ensure all impressions are accounted for.
Test out new tech developed and provide feedback on impact to performance
Researches different strategies that can be used to further improve publisher performance.
Proactively presents ideas to the publisher and collaborates with them on how these ideas can further help them achieve their goals.
Tests different approaches in ad optimization and be up to date with the latest tech developments and advertising news that may affect the publisher and MonetizeMore.
Send End-of-Month Performance Insights report to share the efforts made from last month translated to results and provide updates of what’s the next plan of action
Schedule regular monthly or quarterly updates to go over performance and share new tech recently developed
Runs monthly, and annual comparative reports and checks historical data to provide trend analysis for publishers.
Achieve internal KPI benchmarks and external revenue targets for both MonetizeMore and the publishers.

Qualifications And Skills

Exemplifies MonetizeMore's three core pillars
Reliability, Kaizen & Enterpising,
Highly analytical and has an understanding of statistical theories and principles
Proficient in MS Excel & Google Sheets, and data presentation
Superb attention to detail and is cutthroat with numbers, monitoring, and crushing targets

Has experience with client relations or customer service
Have a good grasp of the different Google ad platforms and how they work
Understands how website ad monetization works
Thrives in a dynamic workplace and adapts to the constant change in the ad tech industry
A self-starter and a sponge for new learnings
Can adjust and is flexible to varying work schedules
Can work under pressure while maintaining a sense of positivity
Speak fluent English and Portuguese.

Great to Have

Has worked with AdSense, Google Analytics, and GAM and has extensive knowledge of Google policies and other platforms
Built or at least managed a website for ad revenue monetization
Understands coding and has a strong tech background
Has worked with WordPress and is knowledgeable when it comes to implementing ads and debugging ad calls

TITULO: Especialista em Análise de Dados - VAGA BANCO
DESCRICAO:
Job Description

Se você possui expertise no tratamento e análise de dados, possui inglês fluente e tem conhecimento em ferramentas avançadas de análise, queremos conhecer você!

Responsibilities And Assignments

As suas principais atuações serão focadas em:
Formatar, programar e executar pesquisas - online e/ou campo - para levantamento de dados;
Coletar, compilar, analisar e interpretar dados diversos;
Simplificar o processo de análise de dados, criando soluções efetivas para o mesmo;
Configurar fonte dos dados a fim de verificar a autenticidade da mesma;
Elaborar estudos e análises sobre negócios diversos.
Requirements And Qualifications

Formação e conhecimentos necessários:
Ensino superior completo em Engenharia de Produção, Ciência da Computação, Estatística, Economia,Matemática ou áreas afins;
Inglês fluente;
Big data, SQL (Structured Query Language), Linguagem de Programação e Machine Learning, Estatística, Artficial Intelligence.
O que fazemos ?

A Log-In planeja, gerencia e opera as melhores soluções para a movimentação de cargas por meio da Cabotagem, complementada por ponta rodoviária. Possuímos uma rede integrada que facilita a movimentação portuária e o transporte porta a porta, graças a uma extensa malha intermodal que permite abrangência geográfica com todo o Brasil e o Mercosul. Oferecemos ainda a armazenagem de carga em nossos Terminais.

NOSSO PROPÓSITO

"Fazer da logística marítima integrada um impulsionador do desenvolvimento sustentável através da nossa gente."

MISSÃO

“Oferecer serviços de navegação de cabotagem e movimentação portuária que gerem relações rentáveis de longo prazo e contribuam para aumentar a competitividade do Brasil.”

VISÃO

“Ser a empresa mais admirada e rentável na logística integrada à navegação, conectando por mar o Brasil e o Mercosul.”

VALORES
Foco no resultado: Somos orgulhosos do nosso crescimento, o que nos leva a focar sempre em ações que geram valor para a empresa.
Segurança: Sem segurança, o nosso negócio não pode almejar qualquer outro objetivo. Priorizamos o cuidado com as pessoas, com o meio ambiente e com as cargas que lidamos.
Atitude de dono: A gente assume responsabilidades, calcula riscos, busca soluções com agilidade e antecipa expectativas e demandas.
Cliente no Centro: O nosso crescimento só se concretiza se formos relevantes para o cliente. Além de mostrar disponibilidade e agilidade ao atendê-lo, temos que mergulhar nas demandas e nos desafios, sendo o agente das transformações.
Simplicidade: Nossa operação é complexa por natureza. Internamente, focamos no que interessa com transparência e clareza. Externamente, somos objetivos, construtivos e consultivos. Nossa comunicação prioriza o olhar e o entendimento do cliente.
Espírito de equipe: Nosso espírito é o de colaborar sempre. Se necessário, argumentamos de forma construtiva. Nossos times não fazem distinção de raça, credo, gênero ou origem. Eles são baseados em habilidades.

TITULO: Analista BI Sr - Vaga afirmativa para mulheres
DESCRICAO:
Vem pra NUCLEA

Já imaginou se os meios de pagamento parassem de funcionar? Pois é, isso nem passa pela nossa cabeça, porque trabalhamos com inovação, confiabilidade e tecnologia de ponta para que você, pequenas ou grandes empresas possam fazer suas transações com total segurança e agilidade, a qualquer hora do dia ou da noite.

Nosso ambiente é feito de gente movida pela vontade de interagir de forma colaborativa e disposta a se desafiar todos os dias. Estamos cheios de energia para continuar transformando o mercado financeiro. Temos muito Orgulho de Ser NUCLEA.

https://www.nuclea.com.br/

Para todas as posições consideramos diversidade e inclusão.

Na Nuclea, valorizamos muito o respeito e a diversidade em nossas equipes, aqui, acreditamos que nossas diferenças são nossas maiores forças.

De acordo com nossos valores, as pessoas estão no centro do nosso negócio e somente elas são capazes de movimentar a economia digital em benefício de toda a sociedade.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Criar, analisar e dar suporte a área de negócios analisando e construindo bases de dados estruturadas com informações provenientes de diversas fontes. Executar atualização e envio de relatório/dashboard da rotina organizacional. Identificar desvios de comportamento nos processos e interagir com os responsáveis para correção. Elaborar a especificação funcional dos sistemas, documentando, com completude, o resultado esperado de seu funcionamento;
Sustentar e manter o correto funcionamento dos sistemas em Produção por meio de atualizações constantes, redução dos erros e atendimentos dentro dos prazos estabelecidos, garantindo a satisfação dos usuários. Alinhar com as áreas de negócio, propor, medir e reportar SLAs (níveis de serviço) para os sistemas de TI;
Autogerir o desenvolvimento profissional, identificando e eliminando gaps de conhecimento técnico, do negócio ou comportamentais, por meio de treinamentos, leitura, pesquisa e atividades de autoconhecimento, acompanhando a estratégia corporativa de colaboração entre todas as equipes da empresa;
Garantir a produção e disponibilidade de documentação de qualidade que reflita todos os aspectos dos sistemas de TI de forma a garantir a independência da empresa com relação a pessoas e/ou fornecedores.

DESCRICAO:
We are looking for a talented Performance Trader & Activation Manager to help us change the world of digital advertising together.

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

KEY FIGURES
2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers
2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth
2021 · Fundraising round of 40M€ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers
2022 · Fundraising round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers

YOUR CHALLENGE
To become a contextual performance expert in a cookieless advertising environment.
Activate and optimize performance campaigns with contextual and cookieless signals.
Achieve the advertiser goals around more than 10 countries.
To grow with the company. We are growing a lot and we need people capable of growing with us.
Work in a technology and highly automated environment

YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF
You have experience in performance campaigns related to leads or qualified traffic.
You have strong analytical capabilities and you like to optimize the campaigns.
You are able to understand the DSP algorithms to get the most out of them.
You understand the programmatic environment and the different needs the campaigns may have depending on the KPI.
You have experience working with advertising platforms such as DSPs, Adservers, SSPs, analytics suites…
You have experience managing teams and multifunctional workflows.
You are eager and curious to keep learning and have a growth mindset.
You want to join a team and you are also able to work independently and autonomously.
You have a fluent level of English.
You have strong communication skills.

WHAT WE OFFER
🚀 Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
💯 One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of New York, Mexico..., 🏖️)
⌛ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
🇬🇧🇪🇸🇫🇷 Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses.
📚 Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)
🍻 We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.
🏋 Gympass

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG
Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

Are you ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Then send us your CV!

Why join us

TRACTIAN is reimagining industrial systems so that every frontline maintenance worker can realize their full potential. We're building software and hardware in one place—disrupting long-standing institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our clients.

Working at TRACTIAN allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Our team members have the autonomy needed to accomplish challenging goals. We are a growth-stage startup and you will work directly with the founders, helping to define the vision, product and user experience.

Data at TRACTIAN

The Data team develops infrastructure, statistical models, and products using IoT data. Our Scientists and Engineers work together to make data—and insights derived from data—a core asset across the company. Our work is ingrained in Tractian’s decision-making process, in the efficiency of our operations and insights, and in the industry-leading experience we provide our consumers.

What You'll Do

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting in-depth data analysis, developing advanced statistical and machine learning models, and providing strategic guidance based on data-driven insights. Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and leading scientific research to develop cutting-edge data science solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong scientific background, exceptional analytical skills, and a deep understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms.

Responsibilities

Develop advanced statistical and machine learning models, and lead scientific research for cutting-edge data science solutions.

Utilize vibration data to detect and predict failures in machinery and equipment.

Develop and implement predictive models for failure probabilities and remaining useful life.

Perform data analysis, preprocessing, and feature extraction on vibration data.

Design and validate machine learning models for failure classification and prediction.

Create informative reports and visualizations to communicate findings and insights.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide mentorship to junior data scientists.

Ensure data governance compliance and stay updated on advancements in failure detection techniques.

Requirements

5+ years in Data Science related fields

Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in a quantitative field such as computer science, mechanical engineering, or a related scientific discipline.

Proven experience as a Data Scientist with a focus on failure detection and vibration analysis.

Strong expertise in signal processing techniques and vibration analysis methodologies.

Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling.

Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or MATLAB.

Experience with feature extraction and preprocessing of vibration data.

Familiarity with relevant tools and libraries for data analysis and machine learning.

Bonus Points

Fluent English proficiency

Compensation

Competitive salary and stock options

R$800/mo for you to use with food in supermarkets, restaurants and delivery

GymPass so you don't sit/work all day

Optional fully funded English / Spanish courses

30 days of paid annual leave

Education and courses stipend

Earn a trip anywhere in the world every 4 years

Day off during the week of your birthday

R$200 a month for remote work allowance

Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy

Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation

Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.

Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

Up to R$5.000 bonus for referring new Blue Caps

TITULO: GESTOR DE TRÁFEGO | ANALISTA DE MÍDIA
Director, Data Management - LATAM, IQVIA Biotech
DESCRICAO:
Join our Global team as a Director of Data Management!

Reports to: Vice President, Data Operations or Designee

Job Overview:

Provide management and leadership for the Data Management group within IQVIA Biotech. Help to assure growth of revenue and profitability through the design and implementation of cost effective, high quality research services for IQVIA Biotech clients. Maintain overall responsibility for the quality and completion of all projects within the Data Management group.

Essential Functions, duties and responsibilities:
Oversee all departmental Data Management activities.
Define departmental standards about corporate processes, procedures, and guidelines related to Data Management.
Ensure adequate staffing of all project teams and coordinate requests for support from other IQVIA Biotech departments and/or external vendors. This includes responsibility for the hiring, promotion, transfer and/or release of staff and management.
Manage the growth, quality and profitability of the Data Management group. This includes development of and adherence to departmental budgets.
Make presentations to clients and other interested individuals related to Data Management
Identify areas for Data Management to contribute to corporate activities and goals and assist with implementation of any necessary training programs.
Act as a mentor for departmental staff and ensure adequate training for team members on specific departmental processes as needed; also, ensure training is documented appropriately.
Write and distribute performance reviews for direct reports; review and approve performance reviews for other subordinate staff.
Ensure that Data Management interfaces effectively with other IQVIA Biotech departments.
Review proposal budgets and text as needed for Data Management specifically and Data Operations in general.
Qualifications:
BS/BA degree with a minimum of 10 years of industry related experience and a minimum of +5 years of supervisor experience is required;
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills required.
Advanced level of English.
What Will Help You Succeed:
Demonstrated knowledge of the Data Management aspects of the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and/or clinical research service industries.
Demonstrated knowledge of clinical research processes and methodologies, including an understanding of current GCP/ICH guidelines applicable to the conduct of clinical research.
A high-level of self-direction and judgment related to the execution of duties and responsibilities.
Ability to lead departmental managers and team members.
Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external parties and maintain positive and open relations.
Ability to create presentations and effectively present information
Proficiency in IQVIA Biotech SOPs and WPs related to Data Management and general IQVIA Biotech corporate processes.
Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and Office applications.
Proficiency with multiple data management processing systems (preferred systems are InForm and Rave)
Travel as required for inter-office visits, bid defenses, client meetings, or other meetings as requested.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

TITULO: Senior Director of Product Management, gt.school (Remote) - $800,000/year USD
DESCRICAO:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?

Are you ready to spearhead a groundbreaking educational revolution? gt.school is seeking a visionary technical product manager to lead the development and implementation of a revolutionary educational platform that combines the captivating appeal of TikTok with the educational power of Neal Stevenson's "A Young Lady's Illustrated Primer." If you are passionate about transforming the way students learn and possess the technical prowess and product management expertise to turn this vision into reality, then we have an opportunity that will ignite your enthusiasm and drive your career to new heights.

At gt.school, we are on a mission to accelerate the pace of learning by 5-10X, leveraging the incredible potential of technology, algorithms, and generative AI. Inspired by the transformative qualities of "A Young Lady's Illustrated Primer," we aim to create a platform where students can discover, explore, and learn at an unprecedented rate. In this position, you will play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life.

Imagine building a TikTok for Education, where students no longer follow influencers but embark on an immersive learning journey, following subjects that pique their curiosity. Instead of aimlessly scrolling through random videos, they will be served targeted, interactive content such as videos, flashcards, and other engaging materials inspired by the learning algorithm in TikTok.

Passion for education and innovation is a must. We are a team of individuals driven by a deep understanding of education, coupled with a rich technical culture and domain expertise. With a school of 200 students already under our belt, we have an intimate knowledge of the challenges and opportunities in the education landscape. Now, with the advent of generative AI, we are poised to take education to new heights, and we are seeking a product owner who shares our enthusiasm and technical skills.

Join us in this exhilarating journey to transform education on a global scale. You will be at the forefront of the Golden Age of disruption in education. If you are ready to apply your technical expertise, product management mindset, and unwavering passion to creating a future where learning knows no bounds, then come and join our team. Together, we will build products that accelerate learning, redefine education, and empower the next generation of learners.

What You Will Be Doing

Conceptualizing and developing the product: collaborating with cross-functional teams to build a platform that revolutionizes education by enabling students to follow subjects and receive targeted learning content.
Making strategic decisions: utilizing market research and data analysis to inform strategic decisions related to product development, feature prioritization, and technology adoption.
Leveraging your entrepreneurial mindset to identify opportunities, evaluate risks, and make informed decisions that align with the company's vision.
Developing an MVP by translating abstract guidance into detailed specifications; actively engaging in discussions and capturing requirements from stakeholders.
Using your product management experience to define sprints, stories, and development milestones for the engineering team.
Embracing an iterative approach, continuously seeking customer feedback, and using data to drive product enhancements.
Providing technical leadership and product delivery: leading the product development team, ensuring high-quality deliverables and adherence to project timelines. Collaborating with engineering leadership to solve problems through automation, advanced algorithms, and optimized data structures.
Sharing the company's passion for education and embracing the disruptive potential of generative AI in the learning process. Staying up to date with the latest advancements in education technology and fostering a culture of innovation within the organization.

Basic Requirements

Senior Director of Product Management key responsibilities

At least 10 years in product management, preferably in a startup or entrepreneurial environment, with a proven track record of success.
Experience owning a product: from defining the requirements to launching the MVP and iterating based on customer feedback, you've been the driving force behind a product.
Strong technical background with the ability to understand and discuss data structures, algorithms, and relevant technologies. Experience with generative AI and machine learning is highly desirable. Must be able to make informed decisions regarding the selection and implementation of appropriate technologies, such as AWS Bedrock or ChatGPT, to support the platform's objectives
Demonstrated leadership capabilities with a focus on driving results, fostering collaboration, and inspiring teams to achieve ambitious goals.
Ability to grasp market dynamics, identify customer needs, and align product strategies accordingly.
A genuine passion for transforming education and leveraging technology to accelerate learning outcomes.

About Gt.school

gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $400 USD/hour, which equates to $800,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.
Crossover Job Code: LJ-5018-BR-Fortalez-SeniorDirector.002
